p: Bioplastics can be classified into three important classes, in function of their source: non-biodegradable bio-based bioplastics (e.g., polyethylene terephthalate (PET), PA); biodegradable bio-based bioplastics (e.g., PLA, polyhydroxyalkanoates (PHA) or starch, other polysaccharides or proteins); or fossil-based biodegradable plastics (e.g., polycaprolactone (PCL)) [ 128] ( Table 2).
